title: Understanding ΔH in a Thermodynamic Cycle
text: In a thermodynamic cycle, a closed system undergoes a series of processes and returns to its original state. This means all state functions, including enthalpy, should return to their initial values.

title: Enthalpy as a State Function
text: Enthalpy (H) is a state function, meaning its value depends only on the current state of the system, not the path taken to reach that state. For any cycle, the final state is the same as the initial state.

title: ΔH for a Complete Cycle
text: Since a closed system returns to its original state after completing the cycle, the change in enthalpy, ΔH, must be zero for the entire cycle.

title: Final State Same as Initial State
text: Considering the system has returned to its initial state, what is the change in enthalpy (ΔH) for the entire cycle?
